comments_since_last_sample.body:
As a reminder, this subreddit [is for civil discussion.](/r/politics/wiki/index#wiki_be_civil)

In general, be courteous to others. Debate/discuss/argue the merits of ideas, don't attack people. Personal insults, shill or troll accusations, hate speech, any suggestion or support of harm, violence, or death, and other rule violations can result in a permanent ban. 

If you see comments in violation of our rules, please report them.

 For those who have questions regarding any media outlets being posted on this subreddit, please click [here](https://www.reddit.com/r/politics/wiki/approveddomainslist) to review our details as to our approved domains list and outlet criteria.

***


*I am a bot, and this action was performed automatically. Please [contact the moderators of this subreddit](/message/compose/?to=/r/politics) if you have any questions or concerns.*
Why are we blaming Biden for 50 Republican Senators and two traitors?
Biden cut what he didn’t have the votes for, calling out Biden is a disingenuous attempt to distract from the failings of the Democratically lead Congress.

Sadly, people still listen to Congressmen when they make wildly stupid claims.  Inflation is the real financial crisis.   Free community college not being included does not make things worse.  It keeps things as they are but will not exacerbate anything.
I thought it was $4 trillion now we're down to $1.75?

At this point, the Dems look out of out of touch. Everyone's life has changed over the last year. The riots. The pandemic. Our workplaces. Our social lives. There is so much that is not the same. You'd think the Dems would at least acknowledge this.

If we really don’t want to have people go to college for free (despite how well that works for developed societies elsewhere), can we at least have some sort universal grant program for on the job training? Incentives for businesses to hire and train NEW workers and eliminate exploitation through unpaid internships?
